vague_description: A farmer must transport a herd of cows using both trucks and helicopters, while balancing the number of trips and pollution limitations.
detailed_description: A farmer decides to move his cows to a nearby farm using helicopters and trucks. A helicopter can take \param{CowsPerHelicopter} cows per trip and creates \param{PollutionPerHelicopter} units of pollution. A truck can take \param{CowsPerTruck} cows per trip and creates \param{PollutionPerTruck} units of pollution. The farmer needs to transport \param{TotalCows} cows and he only has enough money for at most \param{MaxTruckTrips} truck trips. How many of each type of trip should be taken to minimize the total amount of pollution produced?
target_objective: Minimize the total amount of pollution produced by the transportation of cows
target_constraints: Number of helicopter trips is non-negative
Number of truck trips is non-negative
Total number of cows transported is at least TotalCows
Total number of truck trips is at most MaxTruckTrips
target_parameters: Number of cows per helicopter trip
Pollution units created by one helicopter trip
Number of cows per truck trip
Pollution units created by one truck trip
Total number of cows to transport
Maximum number of truck trips allowed
